spc_charts package¶

Submodules¶

spc_charts.spc_charts module¶

Module contents¶

Plotly charts for Statistical Process control

class spc_charts.Constants¶

Bases: object

Represents a table of constants

Methods:

constant()

constant(n, name)¶

Returns the value of the constant given the constant’s name and the value of n. :param n: the value of n :param name: the name of the constant :return: the value of the constant :raises: Exception: if the constant is not found

class spc_charts.IndividualMR(title='', r_title='Range', x_title='Average', chart_width=800, chart_height=600)¶

Bases: XbarR

Shewart Individual and Moving Range chart

Methods:

fit() predict() plot() save() load() save_chart()

Properties:

out_of_control averages_ranges

chart_type = 'IndividualMR'¶
fit(values, labels)¶

Calculates the control limits and center lines for the mean and range charts. :param values: The values to be used to calculate the control limits. The subgroup size must be at least 2. :type values: list, tuple or array :params labels: The labels for each value :type labels: list, tuple or array of strings :type values: numpy.Array where each row is a subgroup and each column is a value in a subgroup. :raises:

ValueError: if there are missing values in values. ValueError: if there are more than one column in values.

has_r_lower_limit = False¶
static moving_ranges(values)¶

Calculates the moving ranges for a single dimension array :param values: single dimension array of values :return: numpy array

predict(values, labels)¶

Calculates the moving range values for plotting on the Range chart. Calculates whether the values and moving ranges are outside their respective limits. :params values: the values :type values: list, tuple or array :params labels: The labels for each value :type labels: list, tuple or array of strings :raises:

Exception: if the control limits have not been calculated. ValueError: if there are missing values in values. ValueError: if there are more than one column in values.

class spc_charts.Run(values, labels, title='', x_title='Average', chart_width=800, chart_height=600)¶

Bases: object

run chart

property centre_line¶
plot()¶
save_chart(path)¶

Saves an image of the chart to a file. :params path: The full path and filename to save to. The file type is

automatically determined by the filename extension. Allowed files types are PNG, JPEG, WebP, SVG and PDF.

class spc_charts.XbarR(title='', r_title='Range', x_title='Average', chart_width=800, chart_height=600)¶

Bases: object

Shewart Average and Range chart

Methods:

fit() predict() plot() save() load() save_chart()

Properties:

out_of_control averages_ranges

chart_type = 'XBarR'¶
fit(values, labels)¶

Calculates the control limits and center lines for the mean and range charts. :param values: The values to be used to calculate the control limits. The subgroup size must be at least 2. :type values: list, tuple or array :params labels: The labels for each subgroup :type labels: list, tuple or array of strings :type values: numpy.Array where each row is a subgroup and each column is a value in a subgroup. :raises:

ValueError: if there are missing values in values. ValueError: if there are less than 2 columns in values.

has_r_lower_limit = True¶
load(path)¶

Loads the chart parameters from a JSON file. :param path: The full path and filename of the file to load

property params¶

Returns the chart parameters

plot()¶

Plots the mean and range values on Plotly chart. :raises: ValueError: if there is no data to plot

predict(values, labels)¶

Transform subgroup values into mean and moving range values for plotting on a chart. Calculates whether the means and ranges are outside their respective limits. :params values: Each row is a subgroup and each column is a value of the subgroup. :type values: list, tuple or array :params labels: The labels for each subgroup :type labels: list, tuple or array of strings :raises:

Exception: if the control limits have not been calculated. ValueError: if there are missing values in values. ValueError: if the number of values in the subgroups used to calculate the control limits is different

to the number of subgroups in values.

property predicted¶
A pandas DataFrame of the predicted data. Columns are:

‘labels’: the labels for each value plotted. ‘x_values: the values plotted on the X chart. ‘r_values: the values plotted on the R chart. ‘x_in_control: True if the value plotted on the Averages chart is within the control limits. ‘r_in_control: True if the value plotted on the Range chart in within the control limits.

Returns:

pandas.DataFrame

save(path)¶

Saves the chart parameters to a json file. :param path: The full path and filename.

save_chart(path)¶

Saves an image of the chart to a file. :params path: The full path and filename to save to. The file type is

automatically determined by the filename extension. Allowed files types are PNG, JPEG, WebP, SVG and PDF.

spc_charts.array_missing_values(values)¶

Raises a ValueError if there are missing values in values.

spc_charts
